title: Biden’s World Bank Pick Looks to Link Climate and Development Goals
description: Ajay Banga will begin a monthlong “global listening tour” to drum up support for his nomination to be the bank’s next president.

title: U.S. Attorney General Garland Meets Zelensky in Ukraine During Surprise Visit
description: A major topic of talks was how to hold Russia accountable for any war crimes committed over the past year.

title: Nobel Prize Is No Defense Against Jail for Ales Bialiatski in Belarus
description: Ales Bialiatski, last year’s Nobel Peace Prize laureate, has been sentenced by Belarus to 10 years in prison, on charges that rights advocates have dismissed as politically motivated.

title: The German chancellor is visiting Biden as urgency builds on Ukraine.
The Sordid Secrets of Cities
description: Machine politics, corruption and violence.

title: Thai Hunger Strikers Calling for Changes to Monarchy Are at Risk of Dying
description: The two young women have not had food for 44 days, part of a campaign urging the government to repeal a law that criminalizes criticizing the royal family.

title: King Charles Will Travel to France and Germany for First State Visits
description: Britain’s new monarch and his wife, Camilla, the queen consort, will attend state banquets in Paris and Berlin later this month.

title: The U.S. Will Send $400 Million in New Military Aid to Ukraine
description: Western leaders have warned of a looming artillery shortage for Ukraine as its troops burn through thousands of shells each day in trying to push back Russian forces.

title: Search of Train Crash Site in Greece Nears an End
description: The authorities were planning to start clearing the debris after Greece’s deadliest rail disaster, with some relatives receiving confirmation that their loved ones had died, while others had to wait.

title: The U.S. will send more ammunition to Ukraine.
Amid Rumors of an Impending Ukrainian Retreat from Bakhmut, the Information War Heats Up
description: The city of Bakhmut, in eastern Ukraine, has taken on a deep symbolic resonance for both sides, which have incurred staggering numbers of casualties.

title: China Increasingly Seen as Antagonist in Diplomatic Talks Globally
description: Tensions over China arise in many gatherings of global leaders and diplomats, as Beijing increasingly plays a spoiler role, often siding with Russia.

title: Belarus Sentences Nobel Peace Laureate to 10 Years in Prison
description: Ales Bialiatski was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize last year along with recipients from Ukraine and Russia.

title: A New Child Care Mandate
description: A great idea — or a problem for semiconductor makers?

title: Rules to Curb Illicit Dollar Flows Create Hardships for Iraqis
description: The regulations were meant to prevent dollar transfers to those targeted by U.S. sanctions on Iran, Syria and Russia. But they have ended up harming ordinary Iraqis who need U.S. currency for business or travel.

title: Paid Accounts on Facebook and Instagram Arrive in Australia
description: Users had mixed feelings about the new subscription service, which bestows exclusive features and a verification check mark.

title: The E.U. Offered to Embrace Ukraine, but Now What?
description: The European Union and NATO have promised a path to membership for the embattled country. But real partnership will hold risks and benefits for both sides.

title: They Sneaked Into a Derelict Arms Plant: Instagrammers or Spies?
description: Three people, including two Russians, arrested on charges of entering an abandoned rifle factory have puzzled Albanian authorities at a time when suspicions about Moscow have been mounting.

title: Cambodian Opposition Leader Is Found Guilty of Treason Ahead of Election
description: Kem Sokha, co-founder of the defunct Cambodia National Rescue Party, was accused of conspiring to overthrow the government and sentenced to 27 years’ house arrest.

title: Germany’s Scholz Visits Washington Amid Worries Over Ukraine War
description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz arrives Friday for a quiet working visit with President Biden, sparking speculation that they will discuss tough questions on how to end the war.

title: Bullying Accusations Snare K-Pop Stars and Athletes in South Korea
description: In South Korea, such allegations have affected the careers of public figures. The takedowns have public support, but critics wonder if some go too far.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: An important exchange between Russia and the U.S.

title: Two Kansas Men Illegally Sold Aviation Equipment to Russia, U.S. Says
description: The Justice Department sad that the scheme was uncovered as the United States has cracked down on illegal exports to Russia since it invaded Ukraine a year ago.

title: At U.S. Base in Germany, Ukraine’s Military Conducts War Games
description: The exercises come as Ukraine is emerging from a winter that was expected to offer a lull in fighting. Ukraine’s president appeared to signal recently that the country is preparing for a major offensive.

title: Rail Safety Upgrade in Greece Is Hobbled by Delays and Neglect
description: The technology would have automatically stopped trains before they collided. Years of delays and neglect have left Greece with a hobbled system.
